name: otorhinolaryngologist

a doctor who studies or treats diseases of the ear, nose, and throat: She is a consultant otorhinolaryngologist. People with severe allergies may seek treatment from an otorhinolaryngologist. See
otorhinolaryngology
More examplesFewer examplesA knowledge of genetics has become important for the otorhinolaryngologist.If you need surgery to fix the structure of your nose, consult your otorhinolaryngologist. Treatment should be performed by a team comprising a neurologist, an otorhinolaryngologist and a speech therapist.
